name: `Our Spirit Never Can be Downed, Our Striving To Be Free`
generalDescription: The coin is issued on the occasion of 190th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko, an outstanding Ukrainian poet (1814-1861) and is made on motives of his poems
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted against the background of a rushnyk (towel) with an ornamentation holographic depiction (on the left); to the right from the Emblem there are mallow flowers. Above there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); beneath in three lines - 20 ГРИВЕНЬ 2004 (20 Hryvnia/2004), as well as - designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the portrait of Taras Shevchenko with facsimile, on the both sides of the portrait there is a composition consisting of characters of his poems; there are the semicircular inscriptions: above - НЕ ВМИРАЄ ДУША НАША (`Our Spirit Never Can be Downed`) beneath - НЕ ВМИРАЄ ВОЛЯ (`Our Striving To Be Free`).
